summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of West Sixty-second Street in the City of Seattle, from a point three hundred (3500) feet west of the west margin of Twenty-second Avenue Northwest to Twenty-second Avenue Northwest, by constructing a sewer therein of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, manholes, catch basins, flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewering and draining of said district, in accordance with Resolution No. 993 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle
